Description: Painted sycomore fig wood reis shabti of Bakenamun with a brown lappet wig, a brown face, a blue collar, a white dress with half-sleeves, carved brown hands resting palm-downwards on the triangular apron of the kilt, brown carved feet and a plinth, the apron is inscribed with a column of black painted hieroglyphs, the back is painted white, the whole figure is thickly varnished.
Condition: fair - split down the back and varnish worn
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore
